Description: Fragmentary turquoise faience amulet of a standing female deity. Preserved from feet to shoulders, the head is missing. The lower end of the wig is visible on both sides. Flat reverse. The figure’s left arm is bent and holds a staff in front of the body. The right arm is rigid and by its side.
Bibliographic references: Spencer 1997 / Amara West I, The Architectural Report (p. 200)
